definition: at one go/at a stretch/for a period of time/forming a gang
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
in a fit of pique/in a fury
to do something at one go/to flow smoothly
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to act in collusion (idiom)

sentences.english: Like an animal at bay, the bandit chieftain laid about in desperation.
sentences.chinese: 土匪頭子困獸猶鬥，在絕望中向四面八方亂打一氣。

sentences.english: Black ant cant stand stimulation in a pet like the giant killer.
sentences.chinese: 黑蟻受不了激，一氣之下就想對擎天下殺手。

sentences.english: In his flay, he screwed up her letter and threw it into the wastepaper basket.
sentences.chinese: 他一氣之下，把她寫來的信揉成一團，扔進了。

sentences.english: So, I got the refrigerator and pushed it over the balcony and it crushed him.
sentences.chinese: 一氣之下，我搬出冰箱，推下陽臺，砸到了他身上。

sentences.english: The boy doesn't like music at all, so he often strummed on the piano.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩根本不愛好音樂，所以他常在鋼琴上亂彈一氣。

sentences.english: Finally the captain still did not agree. He was so angry that he went to find the bureau director.
sentences.chinese: 最後大隊長還是不同意，他一氣之下又去找。

sentences.english: Cao, infuriated, ordered him to the battle front, hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一氣之下，命他立即出征，借敵人的刀殺了禰衡。
那些人沆瀣一氣做壞事。

sentences.english: FAW's HQD Concept is a scary-looking Chinese-style Rolls-Royce Phantom!
sentences.chinese: 一氣紅旗盛事是一款嚇人的中國版勞斯萊斯幻影。

sentences.english: Cao， infuriated， ordered him to the battle front， hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一氣之下，命他立即出征，借敵人的刀殺了禰衡。

sentences.english: "This lousy pen", whisper, again in the old newspaper top in disorder uniform spirit.
sentences.chinese: “這破筆”，嘀咕着，又在舊報紙上亂劃一氣。

sentences.english: Several companies gang up to raise prices.
sentences.chinese: 幾家公司串通一氣擡高物價。

sentences.english: After him vomiting and being blinded for a few hours, he was fine!
sentences.chinese: 他大吐一氣，眼睛瞎了幾個小時之後，跟沒事人一樣。

sentences.english: Yifan throws a necklace that was given to her by Yiguan into a lake.
sentences.chinese: 一帆一氣之下將一官送給她的項鍊丟進小溪裏。

sentences.english: People always conspire to keep the truth from me.
sentences.chinese: 人們總是串通一氣不把真情告訴我。

sentences.english: Like an animal at bay, the bandit chieftain laid about him in desperation.
sentences.chinese: 土匪頭子困獸猶鬥，在絕望中向四面八方亂打一氣。

definition: yin and yang
what is true and what is false/(to get to know) the real situation
muddy/to mix
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
(detectable) movement/(sign of) activity/movement and stillness
all living things
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
to work/to operate/to revolve/to turn around
mystery known only to heaven (archaic)/inscrutable twist of fate/fig. top secret

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to advance or retreat/knowing when to come and when to leave/a sense of propriety
nothingness
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
unintentionally/not in the mood to
The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
